result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger D Shields was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all court costs within 60 days.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger D Shields

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice to deft - Return to sender - Not deliverable as addressed; unable to forward.

Defendant Roger D Shields in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Defendant Roger D Shields in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
14CF306 is set for SEH. Parties have received PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties. In 14CF713, upon plea to charge, the State recommends CFTS.
In 14CF306, the State recommends probation and strongly opposes expungement. The State asks for 6 mos RCJ to be stayed in 14CF306 and in 14CF317, the State asks for CFTS from 5/22 to present.
Defense is asking for expungement but agrees with probation and the CFTS recommendation. Deft addresses the Court.

P-G
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. Expungement is not authorized by the Court. The Court feels it goes against the basis of the statute.
In 14CF306 - Total sentence is 3 yrs WPS bifurcated as 18 mos IC, 18 mos ES/STAYED - 2 yrs probation
     14CF317 - RCJ=CFTS
                        DNA costs, costs

Conditions:
10 hrs CSW if not emp/school = FT
6 mos RCJ/CFTS - STAYED
obey all rules and regs
costs waived
DNA sample & costs
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent
FT emp/school = FT
Must get HS diploma or at a minimum, GED

FAW/vote

If revoked, deft IS eligible for CIP and ERP
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 22, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Roger D Shields in court with attorney Wendy S Paul.  Defendant Roger D Shields in custody.  Jennifer C Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Defense requests that bond be modified on 14CF306 to a higher cash bond.
BTC: Modify Bond on 14CF306 to $1000 cash bond-same conditions  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 28, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Roger D Shields in court with attorney Carolyn H Delery.  Defendant Roger D Shields in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
BTC: VACATE WARRANT  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 09:00 am.
DA Rebecca Somers took warrant to RPD for immediate entry
